p: Phosphorus is a necessary mineral in human body after calcium and possesses a pivotal role in abundant metabolic process, including energy metabolism and bone mineralization, and DNA and RNA framework (Karp, Vaihia, Kärkkäinen, Niemistö, & Lamberg‐Allardt, 2007). The RDA of 700 mg phosphorus is for healthy adults, and phosphorous of 15–51 mg/100 g was reported in OFSP, which is almost equal to the other roots and tubers such as potato (57 mg/100 g), cassava (27 mg/100 g), WFSP (47 mg/100 g), and yam (55 mg/100 g) (Endrias et al., 2016; Lyimo et al., 2010; Nicanuru et al., 2015). In contrast, staple grains contain high concentration of the phosphorous, maize, rice, and wheat are reported to have 210 mg/100 g, 115 mg/100 g, and 288 mg/100 g of phosphorous, respectively (USDA, 2018). The consumption of whole grains is recommended achieving RDA of phosphorous along with the OFSP.
